panels.description:
Members: Total number of instance in this cluster

Quorum : minimal alive instances required, calculated as floor(total members / 2) + 1

Tolerance: max failure nodes allowed, calculated as member - quorum
panels.title: ETCD Spec

panels.description:
All instances among etcd cluster ${cls}

Instance: Goto PGSQL Instance

IP: Goto PGSQL Node

Status: Goto PGSQL Service

Load: max(cpu,postgres,pgbouncer)

Space: Disk space usage max(all device)

Proxy: session number, Goto Haproxy Admin Page
panels.title: ETCD Member List

targets.expr:
sum(up{job="etcd", cls="$cls"}) by (cls) /
 count(up{job="etcd", cls="$cls"}) by (cls)
or on() vector(0)

This metric helps monitor the latency of fsync operations, specifically focusing on the worst-case scenario (99th percentile) over the recent 5 minutes, allowing for better performance analysis and optimization of ETCD's disk I/O operations.

targets.expr: count(ALERTS{alertstate="firing", cls="$cls", job="etcd"}) or on() vector(0)

panels.description: Alerting event graph. Each stripe represent an alerting Event. Gray transparent stipe are pending alerts.

This limit defines the maximum amount of data (in bytes) that can be stored in the ETCD database. When the quota is reached, further write operations will be rejected until space is freed or the quota is increased.
panels.title: Quota Usage

panels.description:
In ETCD, revision refers to the current version of the data stored in the cluster, incrementing with each write operation. It allows users to track changes and retrieve specific versions of keys.

Compacted revision is the lowest revision number that has been retained after the compaction process, which removes old, obsolete data versions to free up space. It represents the point after which all data is considered stable and accessible, ensuring efficient storage management.
panels.title: Revision & Compact
